articles.title: Genetic Quirk Could Explain How Pangolins Can Tolerate Coronaviruses - Newsweek
articles.description: Pangolins are missing two genes that alert mammals to invading viruses. Scientists suggests understanding how they tolerate the virus without these genes could pave way for COVID-19 treatments.
articles.content: Pangolins possess a genetic quirk that may offer them some kind of protection against coronaviruses like COVID-19, according to scientists. If these suspicions prove to be correct, researchers hope it could help pave the way for new treatments to help people … [+3828 chars]

articles.title: FDA bans faulty masks, 3 weeks after failed tests - Chicago Tribune
articles.description: The Food and Drug Administration allowed the sale of several types of N95-style face masks for American health care workers despite evidence from other parts of the federal government that the masks were not effective for blocking the coronavirus
